Improving Federal Agency Transparency and Accountability

Overview: This executive order directs all federal agencies to enhance transparency and accountability in their operations and decision-making processes. The primary goal is to bolster public trust in government.

Bottom Line: While important for good governance, this order has limited direct impact on higher education institutions.

Key Impacts on Higher Education:

Reporting requirements: Universities may need to provide additional information for certain federal grants and contracts.

Auditing: Potential for more stringent audits of how federal funds are utilized.

Public perception: Improved public perception of government partners may modestly benefit universities.

Affected Departments:

Sponsored Programs Office, Government Affairs, Public Relations

Action Plan:

Action Required: No. Stay informed but no immediate action required given minimal impacts.

Immediate Steps (0-30 days):

  • Review order and inform leadership
  • Assess potential grant/contract impacts

Short-term Actions (1-3 months):

  • Monitor implementation of transparency requirements

Long-term Considerations:

  • Adapt reporting as needed

Resource Requirements:

Personnel: No additional personnel needed

Budget: No significant budget impact

Technology: Leverage existing grant management systems

External Expertise: None required
